description.narrative: Future Forum is an independent think tank that focuses on research, analysis and public policy. The main objective of the think tank is to encourage intellectual research and thinking, to positively influence the Cambodian policy narrative and stimulate an evidence-based policy debate

Future Forum är en självständig tankesmedja, etablerad i slutet av 2015. I april 2017 inkom Future Forum till ambassaden med en ansökan om stöd (uppdaterad den 27 juli för att reflektera ny aktivitetsperiod; juli 2017-juni 2020). Huvudsyftet med tankesmedjan är att genomföra oberoende samhällsvetenskapliga studier av hög kvalitet, stimulera en evidensbaserad politisk debatt och därmed påverka den kambodjanska politiska diskursen på ett positivt sätt. Ambitionen är vidare att inkludera ett brett antal aktörer i arbetet, inklusive politiska partier, regeringen, statsförvaltningen och det civila samhället. Ungdomar och studenter är en viktig målgrupp. En särskild satsning kommer också att göras för att få med grupper som inte alltid hörs i debatten, såsom kvinnor, gräsrotsgrupper och etniska, religiösa och sociala minoriteter. Insatsen kommer att genomföras under perioden 1 juli 2017 till 30 juni 2020. Det svenska stödet uppgår till 3,3 miljoner kronor (54 % av den totala budgeten). Stödet lämnas som kärnstöd till Future Forums verksamhet.

tag.narrative: 16.6 - Bygga upp effektiva och transparenta institutioner med ansvarsutkrävande på alla nivåer.
16.6 - Develop effective, accountable and transparent institutions at all levels.

Reproductive, Maternal, Newborn and Child Health (RMNCH)

description.narrative: Given the turbulence of the first year of Future Forum the second year brought stability and development. Main focus of the organisation in 2019 was to consolidate and to develop its core activities. These mainly fall under four areas of work: a) Training of young researchers in policy analysis and in developing policy ideas and policy recommendations. This programme is divided into two sections: (1) Young Researchers Program (YRP) and (2) Junior Research Fellows Program. b) Outlook Cambodia where Future Forum’s core staff together with external researchers and fellows conducted research and carried out evidence-based analysis to generate public policy recommendations in the form of briefing papers and other publications. In 2019 the Cambodia 2040 Book Project was developed. c) Policy Lab which is a platform for young analysts to look critically at social problems and think creatively about how to address those problems. The lab applies the principles of scientific labs: experiment, testing, and measurement -- to social issues--and supports actions that promote youth participation in social and economic policy dialogue, decision making, and policy implementation at national and local levels. d) Community of Researchers (CoR) was created to formalise the continued establishment of a community of researchers working on social, political and economic issues. The community of researchers is a network of both internal and external researchers who engage in opportunities to network and work in collaboration with other members of the community. Ten full time fellows joined the YRP in 2019 doing the one-year programme. The programme was organised around reading, lectures, seminars and field observations. These resulted in a number of articles and briefs, including 17 briefs and three articles in the Phnom Penh Post. The highlight of the Policy Lab was a five-day research booth camp on public policy, strategic foresight and system thinking with 40 participants. The main activity of the CoR was to organise different events, book launch and open seminars. Other part was the Research Colloquium bringing together selected researchers to present their work to colleagues, with “invitation only” to ensure vibrant and open discussion. The institutional structure of Future Forum was also strengthened in 2019 with the establishment of two advisory boards. The Board of Advisors is responsible for reviewing the financial health and management of the organisation and its strategic direction. The Board of Academic Advisors on the other hand are responsible for reviewing the academic and research quality, direction and professionalism.
No indicator available - only a description of the activity results is published
